New Records: Chris Jordan became the first England player to take a men's T20I hat-trick
Chris Jordan took four wickets from his final five deliveries, joining Ireland's Curtis Campher as the only other bowler to achieve that feat at a T20 World Cup
Adil Rashid equalled Stuart Broad's tally of 30 dismissals in T20 World Cups
Key Match Events: Chris Jordan took a hat-trick to help England bowl out USA for 115
Jos Buttler scored an unbeaten 83 off 38 deliveries to lead England to a 10-wicket win
Buttler became the second player in a T20I World Cup to strike five sixes in an over
Pre-Game Insights: England needed to beat USA to boost their net run rate (NRR) and ensure they had a firm grasp on second-place in the group
The target of 116 needed to be chased down in 18.4 overs to ensure England's NRR would go ahead of South Africa's
Post-Match Reflections: England have booked their place in the semi-finals of the T20 World Cup 2024 with a commanding 10-wicket win over USA
Chris Jordan's hat-trick and overall figures of 4 for 10 have secured his place in history
Jos Buttler's 83 not out from 38 deliveries has given England faith in this team combination
Miscellaneous Highlights: England will finish top of the group if West Indies beat South Africa in Group 2's final fixture by a margin fewer than 52 runs
Adil Rashid has been England's standout white-ball bowler for some time, and has been at his best throughout this tournament
